parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The faulty DSG transmission can cause jerking, bucking, or hesitation while driving, making it difficult to control the vehicle, especially in slow-speed maneuvers or when accelerating from a stop. This can lead to accidents or near-misses.
symptoms: The vehicle jerks or bucks when pulling off
reversing
or moving in slow traffic
difficulty starting the car from a stop
transmission slips and then suddenly grabs
harsh shifting from first to second gear
feeling of shifting into neutral instead of downshifting
and occasional stalling when starting from a stop on a hill.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Tail Light Electrical Connector Corrosion and Fire Hazard
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Corrosion in the electrical connectors of the tail lights can cause the lights to malfunction, leading to a fire hazard, and potentially resulting in a vehicle fire.
symptoms: The vehicle's dashboard displays an error message indicating a problem with the right or left rear light
the light bulb symbol with an X through it appears on the screen
the tail lights may not function properly
and in extreme cases
a fire may occur.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Electrical Wiring Failure and Fire Hazard
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of electrical wiring in the vehicle can cause a fire, potentially resulting in a vehicle fire, and posing a risk to the occupants and surrounding property.
symptoms: A burning smell or smoke may be present
electrical components may malfunction
and in extreme cases
a fire may occur.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the DSG transmission can cause the vehicle to lose power, hard shift between gears, and surge, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: Vehicle hard shifting between gears
loss of power
transmission seals leaking between transmission and engine
fluid leaking from multi-clutch cover seal
RPM surge
vehicle surge
engine quit due to rough running and loss of power
RPM fluctuating.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Excessive engine oil consumption can lead to premature engine wear, increased emissions, and potentially cause engine failure, which can result in costly repairs and even accidents.
symptoms: Engine consumes excessive amounts of oil
typically 1 quart or more in less than 1000 miles driven.
